place.name: CEMAIS COMAWNDWR
place.gazetteerText: KEMEYS-COMMANDER, a parish in Pontypool district, Monmouth; on the river Usk, 3 miles NW by N of Usk r. station. Post town, Usk, under Newport, Monmouth. Acres, 500. Real property, £6 43. Pop., 76. Houses, 17. The property is divided among a few. The living is a vicarage in the diocese of Llandaff. Value, £53. Patron, Montague Gore, Esq. The church was recently in disrepair. (In 1870-72, John Marius Wilson's Imperial Gazetteer of England and Wales)
